pork.name: Crispy Pata
pork.description: Deep-fried pork leg (pata) with crispy skin and tender meat, served with a soy-vinegar dipping sauce.
instructions: Boil pork leg with salt, peppercorns, garlic, bay leaf, and water until tender (about 1-2 hours). Drain and pat dry.
Let it rest uncovered in the fridge overnight for crispier skin.
Heat oil and deep-fry the pork leg until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with soy-vinegar dipping sauce.

pork.name: Sisig
pork.description: A flavorful and crispy Filipino dish made with chopped pork, onions, and spices, served sizzling hot.
ingredients: ½ kg pork belly (or pork mask, ears, and liver)
instructions: Boil & Grill: Boil pork in water until tender (about 30 minutes), then grill or fry until crispy. Let it cool, then chop into small pieces.
Sauté: In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Mix & Season: Add chopped pork, soy sauce, calamansi juice, black pepper, and salt. Stir well.
Add Spice: Toss in chili peppers for heat. Mix in mayonnaise for extra creaminess (optional).
Serve Hot: Transfer to a sizzling plate with butter and let it sizzle for a few seconds.

pork.name: Pork Adobo
pork.description: A classic Filipino dish made with pork braised in a savory, slightly tangy soy sauce and vinegar mixture.
ingredients: ½ kg pork belly or pork shoulder (cubed)
1 tsp whole peppercorns (or ground black pepper)
1 tsp sugar (optional, for a slightly sweet taste)
instructions: Marinate pork with soy sauce, garlic, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, sauté onion, then add marinated pork and brown.
Pour in marinade, water, bay leaf, and peppercorns. Simmer for 30 minutes until pork is tender.
Add vinegar (do not stir) and cook for 10 minutes to blend flavors.
Stir, add sugar (optional), and simmer until sauce thickens and meat is flavorful.
For a richer taste, fry pork pieces separately, then return to sauce.
Serve hot with rice. Enjoy!

pork.name: Lechon Kawali
pork.description: Crispy, deep-fried pork belly with a crunchy skin, usually served with liver sauce or vinegar.
instructions: Boil pork belly in water with salt, pepper, and garlic until tender (about 45 minutes).
Let it dry completely, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Deep-fry in hot oil until crispy and golden brown.
Serve with liver sauce or vinegar.

pork.name: Bopis
pork.description: A spicy and flavorful dish made with minced pork lungs and heart, sautéed with chilies and vinegar.
instructions: Boil pork innards until tender, then mince.
Sauté garlic and onion, then add minced pork innards.
Add vinegar, soy sauce, chili, and water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

pork.name: Pochero
pork.description: A tomato-based pork stew with saba bananas, cabbage, green beans, and chickpeas for a slightly sweet and savory taste.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, then add pork and cook until browned.
Add tomato sauce, fish sauce, and water. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add potatoes and saba bananas. Cook until tender.
Add cabbage, season with salt and pepper, then serve.

pork.name: Pork Binagoongan
pork.description: Pork belly cooked in shrimp paste (bagoong) with tomatoes and chili, served with steamed rice.
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes in a pan.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and vinegar, then add water. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add chili (if using) and serve with rice.

pork.name: Pork Igado
pork.description: An Ilocano dish made with pork liver and meat, simmered in vinegar, soy sauce, and bell peppers.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, then add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce and water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add pork liver and vinegar (do not stir). Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir, add bell peppers, and season to taste. Serve hot.

pork.name: Dinakdakan
pork.description: A creamy and smoky Ilocano dish made with grilled pork parts, calamansi, and mayonnaise.
ingredients: 500g pork ears, face, and belly (boiled and grilled)
instructions: Boil and Grill Pork: Boil pork parts until tender, then grill until slightly charred. Chop into small pieces.
Mix Ingredients: In a bowl, combine grilled pork, onion, garlic, calamansi juice, soy sauce, and chili.
Add Creaminess: Stir in mayonnaise and mix well.
Season and Serve: Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve as an appetizer or with rice.

pork.name: Menudo
pork.description: A rich and flavorful tomato-based pork stew with potatoes, carrots, and liver.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, then add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add liver, potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice!

chicken.name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
chicken.description: A crispy, golden-fried chicken roll stuffed with ham and cheese, served with a creamy sauce.
instructions: Flatten the chicken breasts using a meat mallet or rolling pin.
Season both sides with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Place a slice of ham and cheese on each chicken breast, then roll tightly. Secure with toothpicks.
Dredge the rolled chicken in flour, dip in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and fry until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes per side. Alternatively, bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25-30 minutes.
Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice into rounds.

chicken.name: Sinampalukang Manok
chicken.description: A tangy and savory Filipino chicken soup flavored with tamarind and enriched with pechay.
ingredients: 1 cup tamarind leaves or sinigang mix
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in a pot. Add chicken and cook until slightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20-30 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Add tamarind leaves or sinigang mix and tomatoes. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add pechay and let it cook for 2 minutes.
Serve hot and enjoy!

chicken.name: Chicken Caldereta
chicken.description: A twist on beef caldereta, using chicken cooked in tomato sauce, liver spread, potatoes, and bell peppers.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce, liver spread, and soy sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until tender.
Serve with rice.

chicken.name: Tinolang Manok
chicken.description: A comforting soup with chicken, green papaya or sayote, ginger, and malunggay or chili leaves.
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add papaya or sayote. Cook until tender.
Stir in malunggay or chili leaves and season with fish sauce. Serve hot.

chicken.name: Chicken Adobo
chicken.description: Chicken slow-cooked in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and black peppercorns, resulting in a savory-tangy dish.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion in oil. Add chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and water. Add bay leaves and peppercorns.
Simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Adjust seasoning and serve with rice.

chicken.name: Chicken Afritada
chicken.description: A rich stew with chicken, potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers, cooked in tomato sauce.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce and serve hot.

chicken.name: Pininyahang Manok
chicken.description: Chicken cooked with pineapple chunks, milk, and vegetables for a sweet and creamy dish.
ingredients: 1 cup evaporated milk or coconut milk
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook until browned.
Pour in pineapple juice and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add milk, carrots, and bell pepper. Simmer until chicken is tender.
Stir in pineapple chunks and serve.

chicken.name: Chicken Inasal
chicken.description: Bacolod-style grilled chicken marinated in calamansi, garlic, vinegar, and annatto oil, then grilled to perfection.
instructions: Marinate chicken in calamansi juice, vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper for 1 hour.
Grill over medium heat, basting with annatto oil, until cooked through.
Serve with rice and soy sauce with calamansi.

chicken.name: Chicken Curry
chicken.description: A mild and creamy coconut milk-based curry with chicken, potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in curry powder and pour in coconut milk. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until tender.
Serve hot with rice.

chicken.name: Chicken Sotanghon
chicken.description: A warm, light soup with shredded chicken, sotanghon (glass noodles), and vegetables, perfect for cold days.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add sotanghon noodles and carrots. Cook until noodles are soft.
Season with fish sauce and serve hot.

beef.name: Bulalo
beef.description: A rich and comforting Filipino soup made with beef shank, bone marrow, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 corn on the cob (cut into pieces)
instructions: Boil Beef: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add beef shank and simmer for 2-3 hours until tender (or 30-40 minutes in a pressure cooker). Skim off impurities.
Add Flavor: Put in onion, corn, and fish sauce. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Cook Vegetables: Add potatoes and cook until soft.
Final Touch: Season with salt and pepper, then add pechay or cabbage. Let it cook for 5 minutes.
Serve Hot: Enjoy with rice and a dipping sauce of calamansi and fish sauce!

beef.name: Beef Caldereta
beef.description: A rich, slow-cooked beef stew with tomato sauce, liver spread, potatoes, carrots, bell peppers, and sometimes cheese for added creaminess.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion in oil. Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce, soy sauce, and beef broth. Simmer for 1 hour or until tender.
Stir in liver spread, potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook for another 15 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and sugar (if using). Serve hot.

beef.name: Kare Kare
beef.description: A peanut-based stew made with beef shank, oxtail, and vegetables like string beans, eggplant, and banana blossoms, served with bagoong (shrimp paste).
ingredients: 1 cup ground toasted rice (or cornstarch slurry)
instructions: Boil beef shank or oxtail until tender. Set aside the broth.
Sauté garlic and onion in annatto oil. Add peanut butter and ground rice.
Pour in beef broth and mix well. Simmer until thick.
Add beef and vegetables. Cook until veggies are tender.
Season with salt and serve with bagoong.

beef.name: Bistek Tagalog
beef.description: Thinly sliced beef marinated in soy sauce and calamansi, then pan-fried with caramelized onions for a savory-sour flavor.
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Fry onion rings in oil until soft. Set aside.
In the same pan, cook marinated beef until browned. Add marinade and water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Top with fried onions and serve.

beef.name: Beef Pares
beef.description: Tender beef braised in a sweet and savory soy-based sauce, served with garlic rice and a beef broth on the side.
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and beef broth. Add star anise.
Simmer for 1 hour or until beef is tender. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with garlic rice and beef soup on the side.

beef.name: Tapa
beef.description: Cured and marinated beef slices, usually pan-fried and served with garlic rice and fried egg (tapsilog).
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, sugar, garlic, and pepper for 1 hour (or overnight).
Pan-fry in oil until browned. Serve with garlic rice and fried egg (tapsilog).

beef.name: Papaitan Baka
beef.description: An Ilocano dish made with beef innards, flavored with bile for a distinct bitter taste, balanced with calamansi and spices.
ingredients: 500g beef tripe and innards (cleaned and boiled)
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, then add chopped beef innards.
Pour in vinegar and let it cook without stirring.
Add fish sauce, water, and bile extract. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add chili (if using) and season to taste. Serve hot.

beef.name: Nilagang Baka
beef.description: A simple, comforting soup with beef ribs or brisket, potatoes, corn, cabbage, and pechay, simmered until the meat is tender.
ingredients: 2 corn on the cob (cut into chunks)
instructions: Boil beef with onion and water until tender (about 1.5 hours).
Add corn and potatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Add cabbage and pechay. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

beef.name: Sinigang na Baka
beef.description: A tangy soup made with beef short ribs or brisket, simmered in a tamarind-based broth with tomatoes, radish, and string beans.
ingredients: 1 kg beef short ribs or brisket
1 pack sinigang mix (or ½ cup tamarind puree)
instructions: Boil beef with onion, tomatoes, and water until tender (about 1.5 hours).
Add radish and string beans. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in sinigang mix or tamarind puree. Add kangkong.
Season with fish sauce. Serve hot.

fish.name: Sinigang na Salmon Belly
fish.description: A sour tamarind-based soup using rich and fatty salmon belly.
ingredients: 500g Bangus Salmon Belly, cut into serving pieces
1 pack sinigang mix or ½ cup fresh tamarind juice
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil. Add onions and tomatoes; cook for 3 minutes.
Add sinigang mix or tamarind juice and stir well.
Add radish, okra, and green chili. Let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Gently add the fish and cook for 5–7 minutes or until cooked through.
Add kangkong leaves and season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

fish.title: Paksiw na Galunggong
fish.description: Round scad (galunggong) simmered in vinegar, garlic, and peppercorns.
instructions: Arrange the fish in a pot and add ginger, garlic, onions, and peppercorns.
Pour in vinegar and water, then add salt.
Bring to a boil without stirring, then reduce to low heat and let simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add green chili and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve with rice and enjoy.

fish.title: Escabecheng Lapu-Lapu
fish.description: Deep-fried grouper (lapu-lapu) or tilapia topped with a sweet and tangy vegetable sauce.
instructions: Rub the fish with salt and pepper, then coat lightly with cornstarch.
Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry the fish until golden brown. Drain and set aside.
In another pan, heat 1 tablespoon oil and sauté garlic, onions, and bell peppers.
Add vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, tomato paste, and water. Let it simmer for 2 minutes.
Pour the cornstarch slurry and stir until the sauce thickens.
Pour the sauce over the fried fish and serve.

fish.title: Rellenong Bangus
fish.description: Stuffed milkfish (bangus) filled with a mixture of its meat, vegetables, and spices.
instructions: Carefully debone the Bangus, keeping the skin intact. Scrape out the flesh, then flake it.
Sauté onion, garlic, and carrot in a pan. Add the flaked fish meat and season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Remove from heat and mix with the beaten egg. Stuff the mixture back into the fish skin.
Lightly coat with flour and fry until golden brown.
Slice and serve.

fish.title: Daing na Bangus
fish.description: A well-loved Filipino breakfast dish with crispy, tangy flavors.
instructions: In a bowl, mix vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Marinate the Bangus in the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish until crispy.
Serve with rice and spiced vinegar.

fish.title: Ginataang Tilapia
fish.description: Tilapia cooked in coconut milk with chili and vegetables.
instructions: In a pot, sauté onion and ginger.
Add coconut milk and water, then bring to a gentle boil.
Add the fish and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Add green chili and pechay/malunggay. Cook for another 3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve.

fish.title: Inihaw na Bangus
fish.description: A flavorful and juicy grilled fish dish, often stuffed with fresh tomatoes and onions.
instructions: Mix tomatoes and onions and stuff inside the Bangus.
Rub the fish with calamansi juice, soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Wrap in banana leaves or foil and grill for 6-8 minutes per side.

fish.title: Fish Fillet
fish.description: A simple and crispy dish made with coated and fried fish fillets, perfect for dipping in tartar sauce or sweet and sour sauce.
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, dip in egg, then coat with cornstarch.
Fry until golden brown. Serve with tartar sauce.

pasta.name: Filipino-Style Carbonara
pasta.description: A creamy, slightly sweet pasta dish made with ham, bacon, and evaporated milk instead of the traditional egg-based sauce.
ingredients: ½ cup grated cheese (Eden or Quickmelt)
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain.
Fry bacon until crispy, add ham, then set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic and onion in butter. Pour in evaporated milk and all-purpose cream.
Stir in cheese, season with salt and pepper, then let it thicken.
Add pasta to the sauce, mix well, then top with bacon and ham.
Serve hot with extra cheese. Enjoy!nara!

pasta.name: Filipino-Style Spaghetti
pasta.description: A classic pasta dish made with a rich tomato-based sauce, ground meat, and herbs.
ingredients: ½ cup condensed milk (optional, for sweetness)
½ cup grated cheese (Eden or Quickmelt)
instructions: Cook Pasta: Boil spaghetti noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Prepare the Sauce: Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onion. Add ground meat and cook until browned.
Add Flavor: Stir in hotdogs, tomato sauce, banana ketchup, and condensed milk. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Season & Finish: Add salt, pepper, and half of the cheese. Mix well.
Serve Hot: Pour sauce over spaghetti, top with more cheese, and enjoy!

dessert.name: Graham Bar
dessert.description: A no-bake Filipino dessert made with layers of whole Graham crackers, sweetened cream, and fresh mangoes.
ingredients: ½ cup powdered sugar (optional, for extra sweetness)
instructions: Prepare the Cream Mixture: In a bowl, whip the chilled all-purpose cream with condensed milk and powdered sugar until smooth.
Layer the Crackers: In a rectangular dish, place a layer of whole Graham crackers at the bottom.
Add Cream & Mangoes: Spread an even layer of the cream mixture over the crackers, then top with sliced mangoes.
Repeat Layers: Add another layer of Graham crackers, followed by more cream and mangoes. Repeat until you reach your desired thickness, ending with mangoes on top.
Chill & Set: Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight to let the crackers soften.
Slice & Serve: Cut into bars and enjoy this creamy, fruity dessert!
